arm_group.description: Application of Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation (TMS) for 1 day
Application of Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation (TMS) once a day for 5 days

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this pilot study is to test the durability of response to Transcranial
      Magnetic Stimulation (TMS) for the symptoms of Complex Regional Pain Syndrome (CRPS). The
      investigators will test various methods of TMS for varying lengths of time in a  pilot study
      to investigate what the clinical impact.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Age 18 or older

          -  Diagnosis of CRPS (complex regional pain syndrome)

          -  Average pain level reported on Numerical Rating Scale meets entry criteria

          -  Ability to perform the experimental task and procedures.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  MRI contraindication (metal implants or devices, claustrophobia)

          -  TMS Contraindication (eg metal implant or devices near the site of stimulation)

          -  History of epilepsy

          -  History of a psychological or psychiatric disorder that would interfere with study
             procedures, at the discretion of the researcher.

          -  Neurologic illness that would interfere with brain integrity

          -  Current medical condition or medication use that would interfere with study
             procedures or data integrity, at the discretion of the researcher.

          -  Currently pregnant or planning to become pregnant.

          -  On going legal action or disability claim.

authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: treatment session occurs either once, or once a day for 5 days in a row - depending on the arm. Pain at the end of each treatment session will be compared with the baseline pain report.
primary_outcome.time_frame: End of each treatment session (up to 5 days) compared to baseline

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Duration of pain relief after last treatment - measured as length of time until pain returns. Pain will be measured until it returns - this may be at any point (2 days, 1 week, 1 month, 3 months, etc.) - and we will keep assessing until that occurs.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Duration from last treatment until pain returns - up to an estimate of 6 months

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
